page.title: 04Holt Heath Nature Reserve
page.content: HEATHLAND MANAGEMENT Apart from the deer cull the site is managed in other ways.Parties of school children have helped cut the gorse and keep it under control.Ponds have been created to help fight fires on the heath,these have now been used by many insects & plants.The bridle ways across the heath are now being marked by volunteers to help protect the heath from trampling. The Forestry Commission also manages some woodland in the reserve area and next to it.They & the NCC are working together to improve the habitats on all sites. FIRE-is the biggest danger to the heath,although sometimes used to burn out old heather,but otherwise a threat.The largest fire was in 1980 but,between 80/85,6 others .It takes 5yrs for heath to regrow,fauna longer.
